content:
A methanol aqueous solution (50 mL) containing Cu­(NO3)2·3H2O (0.9 g) and PVP (0.4 g) was stirred at room temperature. Next, H3BTC (0.43 g) was dissolved in another 50 mL of methanol to form the ligand stock solution. Then, the above solution was added dropwise to the metal precursor solution by a syringe. A blue colloidal suspension could be observed during the process of dropping (about 10 min). After that, stirring was stopped and the suspension was allowed to stand to age the colloidal nanoparticles for 24 h in dark conditions. The resulting blue solid was collected by centrifugation for 10 min at 10 000 rpm and washed with fresh methanol several times. Finally, the precipitates were dried at 60 °C under reduced pressure overnight for later use.

Preparation of Nanoscale Fe-MOFs

FeCl3·6H2O (1.350 g) and BDC (0.412 g) in 30 mL of DMF were ultrasonically dissolved in a 50 mL Teflon liner and heated at 110 °C for 20 h. The resulting orange solid was harvested by centrifugation for 10 min at 10 500 rpm and washed with fresh ethanol several times. Finally, the precipitates were dried at 120 °C for 6 h under reduced pressure.

Preparation of Nanoscale Zr-MOFs

ZrCl4 (37.5 mg) and TCPP (6.5 mg) were dissolved in 16.25 mL of DMF with ultrasound for about 3 min. Then, dichloroacetic acid (0.25 mL) was added into the solution. The mixture was loaded into a Teflon liner and heated at 130 °C for 18 h. The resulting dark purple solid was collected by centrifugation for 10 min at 10 500 rpm and washed with fresh DMF and ethanol several times. Finally, the precipitates were dried at 130 °C under reduced pressure overnight for later use.
clean_text:
Preparation of Nanoscale Cu-MOFs

A methanol aqueous solution (50 mL) containing Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O (0.9 g) and PVP (0.4 g) was stirred at room temperature. Next, H3BTC (0.43 g) was dissolved in another 50 mL of methanol to form the ligand stock solution. Then, the above solution was added dropwise to the metal precursor solution by a syringe. A blue colloidal suspension could be observed during the process of dropping (about 10 min). After that, stirring was stopped and the suspension was allowed to stand to age the colloidal nanoparticles for 24 h in dark conditions. The resulting blue solid was collected by centrifugation for 10 min at 10000 rpm and washed with fresh methanol several times. Finally, the precipitates were dried at 60 °C under reduced pressure overnight for later use.

Preparation of Nanoscale Fe-MOFs

FeCl3⋅6H2O (1.350 g) and BDC (0.412 g) in 30 mL of DMF were ultrasonically dissolved in a 50 mL Teflon liner and heated at 110 °C for 20 h. The resulting orange solid was harvested by centrifugation for 10 min at 10500 rpm and washed with fresh ethanol several times. Finally, the precipitates were dried at 120 °C for 6 h under reduced pressure.

Preparation of Nanoscale Zr-MOFs

ZrCl4 (37.5 mg) and TCPP (6.5 mg) were dissolved in 16.25 mL of DMF with ultrasound for about 3 min. Then, dichloroacetic acid (0.25 mL) was added into the solution. The mixture was loaded into a Teflon liner and heated at 130 °C for 18 h. The resulting dark purple solid was collected by centrifugation for 10 min at 10500 rpm and washed with fresh DMF and ethanol several times. Finally, the precipitates were dried at 130 °C under reduced pressure overnight for later use.
